title: FDA approves Alzheimer’s drug Leqembi, paving way for broader Medicare coverage
description: Leqembi slowed cognitive decline in a clinical trial, but the treatment is expensive and carries serious risks of brain swelling and bleeding.

title: Payrolls report Friday likely to show a jobs market that is still hot
description: The consensus estimate is that payrolls rose by another 240,000 in June and the unemployment rate is projected to nudge lower to 3.6%.

title: Twitter accuses Meta of stealing trade secrets for its new Threads app
description: Elon Musk's attorney, Alex Spiro, wrote a letter to Meta on Thursday accusing the company of "willful" misappropriation of trade secrets.

title: Threads, Twitter and Mark Zuckerberg's long history of copycat apps and features
description: The Facebook co-founder isn't shy about copying a good idea when he sees one.

title: EU regulators open antitrust probe into Amazon's $1.7 billion iRobot deal
description: The announced probe of Amazon's purchase of iRobot marks the latest regulatory hurdle for large tech companies as they seek to expand.

title: Taylor Swift agreed to FTX partnership, but the crypto exchange bailed, source tells CNBC
description: The nature of the agreement contradicts prior public statements from a high-profile attorney that suggested that Swift pulled out of the contract.

title: Mark Zuckerberg's Twitter rival passed 30 million signups overnight — here's how to use Meta's Threads app and what's missing
description: Threads looks very similar to Twitter and connects automatically to a user's Instagram account.

title: Threads, Meta's Twitter competitor, is not yet available in the EU due to regulatory concerns
description: Mosseri cited "complexities with complying with some of the laws coming into effect next year."

title: Wagner's Prigozhin is in Russia, Belarus leader says, despite Putin deal to end mutiny
description: Wagner Group mercenary boss Yevgeny Prigozhin is in the Russian city of St. Petersburg, Belarusian leader Alexander Lukashenko told reporters on Thursday.

title: Private sector companies added 497,000 jobs in June, more than double expectations, ADP says
description: The U.S. labor market showed no signs of letting up in June, as companies created far more jobs than expected.

title: Elon Musk praises China's 'very strong' A.I. credentials
description: There's a heightened interest in AI and its potentially transformative effects on society.

title: 10-year Treasury yield jumps above 4% after ADP jobs data shatters expectations
description: U.S. Treasury yields jumped Thursday after ADP jobs report.

title: JPMorgan warns UK could see 'hard landing,' says interest rates could hit 7%
description: JPMorgan expects U.K. interest rates to peak at 5.75%, but cautions that they could go higher "under some scenarios," hitting as much as 7%.

title: Qatar Airways reports record revenues, bolstered by FIFA World Cup
description: Qatar Airways announced record annual revenue Thursday after the company's finances were bolstered by the FIFA World Cup.

title: ‘Life is like it is’: TotalEnergies CEO defends strategy despite calls to cut fossil fuel production
description: The comments by TotalEnergies CEO Patrick Pouyanne come after French riot police fired tear gas at climate activists trying to prevent the firm's AGM.

title: China says it told the U.S. and Europe about the export controls in advance
description: China's Ministry of Commerce said Thursday the country told the U.S. and Europe about this week's export controls in advance.

title: Janet Yellen arrives in Beijing on mission to find common ground for U.S. and China
description: Yellen's trip deepens a thaw in U.S.-China ties, coming weeks after Secretary of State Antony Blinken's own visit to Beijing in mid-June.

title: A $12 phone is opening doors for rural India to get on the internet
description: The telecommunications arm of India's richest company, Reliance Industries, has launched a $12 internet-enabled feature phone.

title: OPEC chief says the search is on for new members of the oil producers' group
description: OPEC chief Haitham al-Ghais would not be drawn into disclosing the names of potential new members.

title: Chinese investors are not expecting much stimulus as growth stalls, Goldman Sachs says
description: Goldman Sachs' said its clients in mainland China have "low expectations" for further stimulus measures to prop up the economy, the firm's economists wrote in a Wednesday note.

title: Bad news for nervous flyers: Turbulence is getting worse as the planet warms
description: A recent study from researchers at the University of Reading in England provides some insight into how our skies have changed over the past few decades.

title: South Korea wants to be a top A.I. hub — its memory chip dominance could be an advantage
description: South Korea is aiming to become one of the world's top three AI powerhouses by 2027, following closely behind the U.S. and China, according to the nation's "digital strategy."

title: Canadian labor minister meets with provincial counterpart in day five of Canada's port strike
description: On Tuesday, both the International Longshoremen and Warehouse Union and the British Columbia Maritime Employers Association said they were pausing negotiations.

title: The best places to eat in Andalusia — from a chef with three Michelin stars
description: From bars to beachside restaurants, Chef Angel Leon of the three-Michelin-starred Aponiente recommends where to eat on the southern tip of Spain.

title: A global commodities rout is fueling fears of a bleak economic future
description: Global commodities have seen a more than 25% slump over the last 12 months.
